hotelOptions.hotelAddress: 12, Jawaharlal Nehru Rd, Esplanade, Dharmatala, Taltala, Kolkata, West Bengal 700013
hotelOptions.description: A well-located 4-star hotel in the heart of Kolkata, offering comfortable rooms, dining options, and easy access to major attractions. Known for its warm hospitality.

hotelOptions.hotelAddress: 1&2, Little Russel St, Kankaria Estates, Park Street Area, Kolkata, West Bengal 700071
hotelOptions.description: An elegant 4-star hotel combining old-world charm with modern amenities. Features multiple restaurants, a bar, and is situated close to Park Street.

hotelOptions.hotelAddress: 8A, Lindsay St, New Market Area, Dharmatala, Taltala, Kolkata, West Bengal 700087
hotelOptions.description: A budget-friendly yet comfortable hotel located right next to New Market, ideal for shoppers and those looking for central access. Offers basic amenities.

hotelOptions.hotelAddress: 23, Lala Lajpat Rai Sarani, Kankaria Estates, Park Street Area, Kolkata, West Bengal 700020
hotelOptions.description: A boutique 3-star hotel offering contemporary rooms and a pleasant stay. Located near Park Street, it provides good value for money with modern facilities.

hotelOptions.hotelAddress: 124, Prince Anwar Shah Rd, Lake Gardens, Kolkata, West Bengal 700045
hotelOptions.description: A comfortable and affordable hotel offering decent amenities and services. Slightly away from the absolute city center, but well-connected.

hotelOptions.hotelAddress: 11/1, Fern Rd, Ballygunge, Kolkata, West Bengal 700019
hotelOptions.description: A clean and modern budget hotel offering essential comforts. Good for travelers looking for an economical yet pleasant stay in a residential area.

hotelOptions.hotelAddress: 56, Jawaharlal Nehru Rd, Esplanade, Dharmatala, Taltala, Kolkata, West Bengal 700071
hotelOptions.description: A contemporary budget hotel located centrally, offering comfortable stays with modern amenities. Close to major attractions and shopping areas.

schedule.placeDetails: An iconic large marble building built between 1906 and 1921, dedicated to the memory of Queen Victoria. It houses a museum and is surrounded by vast, lush gardens.
schedule.ticketPricing: Indians: INR 30, Foreigners: INR 500 (Museum); Gardens: INR 20

schedule.placeDetails: An Anglican cathedral noted for its Gothic Revival architecture. It is the first Episcopal Church of Asia and is known for its stained glass windows and frescoes.
The largest and oldest museum in India, established in 1814. It has rare collections of antiques, armour and ornaments, fossils, skeletons, mummies, and Mughal paintings.

A historic market complex dating back to 1874, offering a wide array of goods from clothing, jewelry, and electronics to food items and flowers. Great for local shopping and experiencing the city's pulse.
Known as 'Food Street' and 'The Street that Never Sleeps', Park Street is famous for its restaurants, cafes, pubs, and vibrant nightlife. Perfect for an evening stroll and dinner.
schedule.travelTimeFromPrevious: 10 minutes walk/short taxi from New Market

schedule.placeDetails: A cantilever bridge over the Hooghly River, connecting the twin cities of Howrah and Kolkata. It's an iconic symbol of Kolkata, known for its sheer scale and constant activity.
One of Asia's largest and oldest flower markets, located just below the Howrah Bridge. A chaotic yet vibrant spectacle of colours and scents, especially lively in the early morning.
schedule.travelTimeFromPrevious: 5-10 minutes walk from Howrah Bridge viewpoint

schedule.placeDetails: A famous Hindu temple complex dedicated to the goddess Kali, situated on the eastern bank of the Hooghly River. It was built by Rani Rashmoni and is closely associated with Ramakrishna Paramahamsa.
schedule.travelTimeFromPrevious: 45-60 minutes by taxi/cab (including lunch break consideration)

schedule.placeDetails: The headquarters of the Ramakrishna Math and Mission, located on the west bank of the Hooghly River. It's a serene campus known for its architectural fusion of Hindu, Christian, and Islamic styles, symbolizing the unity of all religions.
schedule.travelTimeFromPrevious: 15-20 minutes by ferry/taxi from Dakshineswar Kali Temple

schedule.placeDetails: A historic ghat built in 1841 during the British Raj, located on the banks of the Hooghly River. It offers picturesque views of the Vidyasagar Setu (Second Hooghly Bridge) and is popular for evening strolls, boat rides, and watching sunsets.
schedule.ticketPricing: Free (Boat rides available for a fee)
schedule.travelTimeFromPrevious: 30-45 minutes by taxi/cab from Belur Math
